title: Is 'points of contrast' an actual phrase? - Quora

response.answer_text: I have heard people say “a point of contrast.” You may have heard teachers ask you to “compare and contrast” on a test, which means they want you to write first about similarities, then the differences on a topic. So a contrasting point is one that frames a difference. For example, “San Francisco is known for its tourist attractions and expensive neighborhoods. A point of contrast are the City’s homeless encampments under freeways and in Golden Gate Park.”
